div.p: Threat hunting is an exercise to find cyber attacks that have penetrated your environment without raising alarms. Threat hunting involves going beyond what you already know and is about venturing into the unknown to discover new threats. This is in contrast to traditional cybersecurity investigations and responses, which stem from system alerts, and occur after potentially malicious activity has been detected.

Intentional hunting often relies on knowing various attacker techniques and applying them to your environment. Equally important for any hunt initiative should be to gain a deeper understanding of the environment. Ingest machine data from multi-cloud and on-premises deployments for full visibility to quickly detect malicious threats in your environment.
